title: Questions a waiter or waitress might ask
context: Ask the customers if they are ready to order or need more time.

content.bestLine: Can I take your order now?

neutral.text: Can I put in your order?
Are you all set to order?
Shall I put your order in?
Do you need a few more minutes?

formal.text: May I have the pleasure of taking your order?
Are you prepared to place your order?
Shall I proceed with taking your order?
Is it convenient for you to order at this time?
May I take your order now, please?
Are you ready to proceed with your order?

patterns.meaning: Asking if the customer is ready to order
Asking if the customer needs additional time

dialogs.description: Waiter asking if customers are ready to order

lines.speaker: Waiter
lines.text: Can I take your order now?

lines.speaker: Customer
lines.text: Yes, we're ready. I'll have the steak.

dialogs.description: Waiter checking if customers need more time

lines.speaker: Waiter
lines.text: Do you need a few more minutes to decide?

lines.speaker: Customer
lines.text: Yes, please. We're not quite ready yet.
